TEXT.id: PaiwanCh2_049_ORIGIN OF THE FIVE YEAR FESTIVAL
TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}

S.FORM: naizua ti sa Rungiłingan a natsemukatsukar.
naizoa ti sa Rongiljingan a nacemokacokar.
S.TRANSL: There was (in heaven (OA)) a person called Rungiłingan who had been drying some clothes.

S.FORM: matjani a łeteku a sema Lingutjał.
matjani a ljeteko a sema Lingotjalj.
S.TRANSL: He fell down to the Lingutjał house,

S.FORM: sa djumaken ni sa Łemud.
sa djomaken ni sa Ljemod.
S.TRANSL: and was found by Łemud.

S.FORM: "kemasinu sun?"
"kemasino son?"
S.TRANSL: “Where are you from?”

S.FORM: "kemasi tjarivavaw aken.
"kemasi tjarivavaw aken.
S.TRANSL: “I’m from heaven.

S.FORM: pai petsunguan aken, uła ken a kiayan tua tsevuł a sema tjarivavaw."
pai pecongoan aken, olja ken a kiayan toa cevolj a sema tjarivavaw."
S.TRANSL: Light a fire for me, so that I can go up to heaven with the smoke.”

S.FORM: sa petsungu anga.
sa pecongo anga.
S.TRANSL: He lit a fire.

S.FORM: "nu sika lima sa kiayan anga tua tsevuł, uri seman pulingaw amen.
"no sika lima sa kiayan anga toa cevolj, ori seman polingaw amen.
S.TRANSL: “On the fifth day, come up with the smoke; we will make (you) a shaman.

S.FORM: nu sika lima sa nu mangtjez sun i tjarivavaw, tjukatsasavanu anga; sa kilangdangda-i anga nu malada men.
no sika lima sa no mangtjez son i tjarivavaw, tjokacasavano anga; sa kilangdangda-i anga no malada men.
S.TRANSL: On the fifth day when you come to heaven, stay in the courtyard, and listen while we perform the rite.

S.FORM: nu talangtangtang, sa tjiłivaru anga, nu uri nemingats anga men."
no talangtangtang, sa tjiljivaro anga, no ori nemingac anga men."
S.TRANSL: When it’s getting light, go in the indoor granary, when we are beginning to recite(?).

S.FORM: saka i tjiłivar anga ti sa Łemud, a patsutsun tua kisan pulingalingaw.
saka i tjiljivar anga ti sa Ljemod, a pacocon toa kisan polingalingaw.
S.TRANSL: So Łemud was in the granary watching the rite of making a shaman.

S.FORM: ka małia, "ki ken a vaik anan," aya ti sa Łemud.
ka maljia, "ki ken a vaik anan," aya ti sa Ljemod.
S.TRANSL: Next day Łemud said: “I’ll be off now.”

S.FORM: "anema a nu vusam, anema nu tjałayan?"
"anema a no vosam, anema no tjaljayan?"
S.TRANSL: “What small and bigger seeds do you have?”

S.FORM: "qaliḍuḍu, vala."
"qalidrodro, vala."
S.TRANSL: “We have qaliḍuḍu and vala taro.”

S.FORM: "katsu tusa vusam, a tjelu a vusaman, a vuluvulung, a tjamekuł, a łailiman.
"kaco tosa vosam, a tjelo a vosaman, a volovolong, a tjamekolj, a ljailiman.
S.TRANSL: “Take these small seeds of three kinds: vuluvulung, tjamekuł and łailiman millet.

S.FORM: ari sa-u tjua Qutsułi.
ari sa-o tjoa Qocolji.
S.TRANSL: Off you go to Qutsułi.

S.FORM: katsu tua ḍiḍi a vulivuliqan."
kaco toa dridri a volivoliqan."
S.TRANSL: Take a dappled pig.”

S.FORM: "małevłeveq amen," ayain ni sa Rungiłingan.
"maljevljeveq amen," ayain ni sa Rongiljingan.
S.TRANSL: “We are celebrating the five year festival,” added Rungiłingan;

S.FORM: "alau pai kałevequ anga, sa tsektseku anga tua kasiw."
"alao pai kaljeveqo anga, sa cekceko anga toa kasiw."
S.TRANSL: “so you too celebrate it, and stick wooden stakes in the ground.”

S.FORM: sa vaik anga ti sa Łemud a sema tjariteku.
sa vaik anga ti sa Ljemod a sema tjariteko.
S.TRANSL: Łemud went back to the world below.

S.FORM: mangtjez ti sa Łemud.
mangtjez ti sa Ljemod.
S.TRANSL: He arrived;

S.FORM: tsemektsek tua kasiw; mangtjez i Livulivuan.
cemekcek toa kasiw; mangtjez i Livolivoan.
S.TRANSL: he stuck stakes in. He got to Livulivuan,

S.FORM: sa vaik a sema Rusivavan uta tsemektsek.
sa vaik a sema Rosivavan ota cemekcek.
S.TRANSL: and went to Rusivavan sticking in stakes.

S.FORM: saka "nakuya tsu a neka nu pulingaw," aya.
saka "nakoya co a neka no polingaw," aya.
S.TRANSL: “It’s bad there are no shamans,” he (or they) said;

S.FORM: sa kisan pulingaw a marekakakaka a małe lima, a siruvetjek ni sa Łemud.
sa kisan polingaw a marekakakaka a malje lima, a sirovetjek ni sa Ljemod.
S.TRANSL: and five siblings, Łemud’s siblings, became shamans.

S.FORM: sa tulu-i tuazua kinitulu a kasi tjarivavaw; sa patagił anga uta małeveq a i tjariteku.
sa tolo-i toazoa kinitolo a kasi tjarivavaw; sa patagilj anga ota maljeveq a i tjariteko.
S.TRANSL: And he taught them what he had learnt from heaven; and they began to celebrate the festival in the world below too.

S.FORM: saka izua.
saka izoa.
S.TRANSL: And it goes on.

S.FORM: saka amin.
saka amin.
S.TRANSL: The end.
